definition: to draw (e.g. a bow)/to pull/to stretch sth/to extend/to lengthen/to involve or implicate in/to attract/to lead/to guide/to leave/to provide evidence or justification for/old unit of distance equal to 10 丈[zhang4], one-thirtieth of a km or 33.33 meters
to go forward/to advance/to go in/to enter/to put in/to submit/to take in/to admit/(math.) base of a number system/classifier for sections in a building or residential compound

sentences.english: At appropriate places, he introduces the criticisms of the creationists and provides answers.
sentences.chinese: 在合适的地方他引进了对神创论的评判并提供解答。

sentences.english: The company has imported a complete set of automatic production lines and up-to-date technology.
sentences.chinese: 公司引进了自动化生产线的全套设备和先进技术。

sentences.english: West Ham have admitted that they fielded players illegally.
sentences.chinese: 西汉姆承认他们是非法引进球员。

sentences.english: Chinese Hamsters were introduced into the UK pet market in the 1960s.
sentences.chinese: 二十世纪六十年代被引进到英国宠物市场。

sentences.english: An end group correction factor was introduced for getting the true weight distribution of chain length.
sentences.chinese: 引进了一个端基改正因子以获得真实的重量链长分布。
肯当时还引进了身长18米的铰接式公交车。

sentences.english: To increase this transition probability, the dissimilation operation is introduced.
sentences.chinese: 要增加这种转移概率，需要引进异化操作。

sentences.english: and strong demands from China for the transfer of technology from the rich to others.
sentences.chinese: 中国强烈要求发达国家将相关技术引进其它地区。

sentences.english: Since the beginning of the new century, the beginning of the large-scale introduction of this subject.
sentences.chinese: 从新世纪开始，这一学科开始被大规模的引进来。
“神经元”这个词是在1891年被引进的。

sentences.english: Some people have been re-introducing native plants, others have been planting food and flowers.
sentences.chinese: 有人引进了故乡的植物，还有些人就种了些粮食和花。

sentences.english: There was more hoopla surrounding the introduction of incandescent lights than there seems to be surrounding compact fluorescents.
sentences.chinese: 当时，引进白炽灯可比引进紧凑荧光灯热闹许多。

sentences.english: There was more hoopla surrounding the introduction of incandescent lights than there seems to be surrounding compact fluorescents.
sentences.chinese: 当时，引进白炽灯可比引进紧凑荧光灯热闹许多。

sentences.english: Such a request should be solved finally by the Introuductio…
sentences.chinese: 这样的要求最终应该由引进“永租权”制度来解决。

sentences.english: The first whole-set equipment was brought in from Japan.
sentences.chinese: 第一套成套设备是从日本引进的。

sentences.english: Trams, or electric streetcars, were first introduced in New Zealand in 1905.
sentences.chinese: 有轨电车又叫电车，于1905年被首次引进新西兰。

definition: to draw into/to pull into/to introduce
to become a member of an alliance or union/to align/to join/participate
to hire at a high salary
to sell/to offer for sale/to put on the market
to sign a contract or agreement
to transfer to another club (professional sports)
